public class JavaFile
extends ActivatableVisitor
implements Nameable

A representation of a java file.

Field Detail

fileName

private java.lang.String fileName
The name of the file.

classes

private java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,JavaClass> classes
Keep a local list of all the classes we have in this one file.

imports

private java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,JavaClass> imports
The list of classes that are imported and ready for use in this file. This only handles external classes that have been imported; none of the package classes are here. Local name of class -> JavaClass (Object -> JavaClass)

Constructor Detail

Store the file name for the file and pass off the node for future use.

Method Detail

setFileInfo

private void setFileInfo(java.lang.String file)
Sets up our information about the file we are looking at. By default, it will set the package to "default", store the path to the file, and extract the file name (from test/test2/some.java, it will extract "some" as the name).

Parameters:
file - The full path to the file (in /location/to/file.java form).

defaultImports

private void defaultImports()
Setup our default imports. Anything that is imported by default into a file by java should be listed here so that we can correctly simulate a java environment.

process

protected void process()
Activates all the classes in this file as the file is being marked as used, and we now need them.

Specified by:
process in class ActivatableVisitor

Prints out all our junk.

getName

public java.lang.String getName(boolean fullName)
Gets the java name.

Specified by:
getName in interface Nameable
Parameters:
fullName - True for the fully-qualified java name; false for just the last part of the name.

getImport

public JavaClass getImport(java.lang.String cls)
Searches for a class that has been imported into this file. Given the name of a class, in "Object" form, it will search its local imports to expand to the full name of the class (ie. expand "Object" to "java.lang.Object") and return the JavaClass associated with that import. If given the name of the class in "java.lang.Object" form, it will merely run to JavaPackages.getClass(java.lang.String) to get the class.

Parameters:
cls - The name of the class to get, in the "Object" or "java.lang.Object" form. In other words, any way that it could be typed in the code.

importFile

private void importFile(java.lang.String pkg)
Imports a module into this file given something like "java.lang.Object". This is the main handler for all import statements.

Parameters:
pkg - The name of a file to import, in "java.lang.Object" form.

importPackage

private void importPackage(java.lang.String pkg)
Used for importing * declarations.

Parameters:
pkg - The name of the package from which to import all files.

visitPackageDeclaration

public void visitPackageDeclaration(xtc.tree.GNode n)
For the package declaration -- sets the current package we are looking at.

visitImportDeclaration

public void visitImportDeclaration(xtc.tree.GNode n)
Grabs the imports and imports them into the file using importFile(String)

visitClassDeclaration
